docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats and Republicans alike are rethinking the vast, costly system of policing and incarceration that was born of a crime wave decades ago.

headline.main: In a Safer Age, U.S. Rethinks Its ‘Tough on Crime’ System
headline.print_headline: In a Safer Age, U.S. Rethinks Its ‘Tough on Crime’ System

docs.abstract: News Analysis; both Democrats and Republicans are rethinking huge, expensive infrastructure of crime control and imprisonment that was established during violent crime wave that peaked in the early 1990s; decline in crime since then has diminished nation's rates of murder, robbery and assault by half.
docs.snippet: Democrats and Republicans alike are rethinking the vast, costly system of policing and incarceration that was born of a crime wave decades ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss an Op-Ed essay about some surprising poll results.
docs.snippet: Readers discuss an Op-Ed essay about some surprising poll results.

docs.lead_paragraph: A report by the Congressional Research Service found that many concerns among medical device manufacturers about a tax under the Affordable Care Act were unfounded.

headline.main: New Analysis Challenges Arguments for Repealing Tax on Medical Devices
headline.print_headline: New Analysis Challenges Arguments for Repealing Tax on Medical Devices

docs.abstract: Congressional Research Service report finds that many concerns among medical device manufacturers about a tax under the Affordable Care Act are unfounded; determines that effect on jobs, research and profits are of minimal import and tax will be passed on in higher prices.
docs.snippet: A report by the Congressional Research Service found that many concerns among medical device manufacturers about a tax under the Affordable Care Act were unfounded.

docs.lead_paragraph: Attorneys for North Dakota and Arkansas urged a U.S. appeals court panel on Tuesday to overturn federal judge decisions that block state laws that would shorten the period allowed for a woman to end a pregnancy.

headline.main: North Dakota, Arkansas Ask Court to Allow Abortion Curbs
headline.print_headline: North Dakota, Arkansas Ask Court to Allow Abortion Curbs

headline.main: New Report Urges Less Intervention in Births

docs.abstract: “If overtreatment is defined as instances in which an individual may have fared as well or better with less or perhaps no intervention,” says a new report, “then modern obstetric care has landed in a deep quagmire.”
docs.snippet: “If overtreatment is defined as instances in which an individual may have fared as well or better with less or perhaps no intervention,” says a new report, “then modern obstetric care has landed in a deep quagmire.”

docs.lead_paragraph: A closely watched legal fight over two of the nation's most stringent abortion bans resumed Tuesday, with attorneys for North Dakota and Arkansas asking a federal appeals court to reinstate two laws overturned by two separate lower federal courts.

headline.main: Appeals Court Hears Arkansas, North Dakota Abortion Cases
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Hears Arkansas, North Dakota Abortion Cases

docs.snippet: A closely watched legal fight over two of the nation's most stringent abortion bans resumed Tuesday, with attorneys for North Dakota and Arkansas asking a federal appeals court to reinstate two laws overturned by two separate lower federal courts.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Sen. Claire McCaskill said Monday that she won't run for Missouri governor in 2016, avoiding a potential Democratic primary with Missouri's attorney general in favor of a continued role in Washington.

headline.main: McCaskill Says She Won't Run for Missouri Governor in 2016
headline.print_headline: McCaskill Says She Won't Run for Missouri Governor in 2016

docs.snippet: U.S. Sen. Claire McCaskill said Monday that she won't run for Missouri governor in 2016, avoiding a potential Democratic primary with Missouri's attorney general in favor of a continued role in Washington.
